name: The City of Philadelphia v. Philadelphia and West Chester Turnpike Road Company, Appellant
name_abbreviation: City of Philadelphia v. Philadelphia & West Chester Turnpike Road Co.

judges: Before Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell and Dean, JJ.
parties: The City of Philadelphia v. Philadelphia and West Chester Turnpike Road Company, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Dean,
The main question which determines this contention, has been answered in tbe opinion of West Philadelphia Passenger Railway Company against same defendant, handed down this day, ante, p. 459.
The decree of the court below is affirmed at costs of appellant.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Dean,

casebody.head_matter:
The City of Philadelphia v. Philadelphia and West Chester Turnpike Road Company, Appellant.
Argued Jan. 18, 1898.
Appeal, No. 108, Jan. T., 1898, by defendant, from decree of C. P. No. 4, Phila. Co., Dec. T., 1894, No. 435, on bill in equity.
Before Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell and Dean, JJ.
Affirmed.
July 21, 1898:
